class ImageSlicer:
    @staticmethod
    def sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu=1000.0):
        height = image.shape[0]
        width = image.shape[1]
        image_ar = width / height
        x1 = np.min(curve[:, 0])
        x2 = np.max(curve[:, 0])
        y1 = np.min(curve[:, 1])
        y2 = np.max(curve[:, 1])
        extent = (x1, x2, y1, y2)
        x_abs = x2 - x1
        y_abs = y2 - y1
        clip_ar = x_abs / y_abs
        if clip_ar < image_ar:
            new_height = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(height, y_abs*dpu)), height-1)
            new_width = int(new_height * clip_ar)
        else:
            new_width = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(width, x_abs*dpu)), width-1)
            new_height = int(new_width / clip_ar)
        origin = (np.random.randint(0, width - new_width), np.random.randint(0, height - new_height))
        sliced_image = image[origin[1]:origin[1] + new_height, origin[0]:origin[0] + new_width]
        path = Path(curve)
        return sliced_image, extent, path
    @staticmethod
    def ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_radius=0.0, outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, inner_radius, theta1, theta2)
        curve2 = np.flip(CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, outer_radius, theta1, theta2), 0)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def serrated_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=3, aligned=True, teeth_width=0.05, inner_radius=0.0,
                          outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6):
        segments = np.maximum(1, segments)
        theta = np.linspace(theta1, theta2, segments + 1)
        inner_rho = np.array([inner_radius + (i % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        outer_rho = np.array([outer_radius - ((i + aligned) % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        curve1 = np.vstack((inner_rho, theta)).T
        curve2 = np.vstack((outer_rho, np.flip(theta))).T
        curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, n_periods=2, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8,
                           amplitude=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/2):
        inner_curve = CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, inner_radius+amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset)
        outer_curve = np.flip(CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, outer_radius-amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset), 0)
        outline_curves = [inner_curve, outer_curve]
        curve = np.vstack((inner_curve, outer_curve))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.5, 0.05, "cartesian"),
                        outer_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.8, 0.05, "cartesian"), theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        if inner_curve is None:
            curve1 = np.array([[0, 0]])
        else:
            (curve1, periods1, radius1, width1, coordinate_type1) = inner_curve
            if coordinate_type1 == "polar":
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            else:
                curve1 = np.vstack((-curve1[:, 0], curve1[:, 1])).T
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
            curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            curve1 = np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve1, i * (theta2 - theta1) / periods1, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods1)])
        (curve2, periods2, radius2, width2, coordinate_type2) = outer_curve
        if coordinate_type2 == "polar":
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve2, (radius2, radius2+width2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
            curve2 = np.vstack((-curve2[:, 0], curve2[:, 1])).T
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        curve2 = np.flip(np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve2, i*(theta2-theta1)/periods2, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods2)]), 0)
        if left_side and right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2, np.array([[curve1[0, 0], curve1[0, 1]]])))]
        elif right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2))]
        elif left_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve2, curve1))]
        else:
            outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def random_ring_arc(image, dpu=2000.0, grid_size=(5, 5), step_size=(1, 1), inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False, interpolation="spline") -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.random_edge(grid_size, step_size, interpolation)
        curve2 = CurveGenerator.random_edge(grid_size, step_size, interpolation)
        inner_curve = (curve1, 1, inner_radius, width, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (curve2, 1, outer_radius, width, "cartesian")
        (image, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, theta1, theta2, left_side, right_side)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def regular_polygon_ring_arc(image, dpu=2000.0, sides=1, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6, left_side=False, right_side=False):
        curve = np.array((np.linspace(0, 1, sides+1), np.zeros(sides+1))).T
        inner_curve = (curve, 1, inner_radius, 0, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (curve, 1, outer_radius, 0, "cartesian")
        (image, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve,
                                                                            theta1, theta2, left_side, right_side)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def leaf(image, dpu=1000.0, width=0.1, height=0.2, half=False):
        curve = CurveGenerator.leaf(np.linspace(0, 1, 100), width, height, half)
        outline_curves = [curve]
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def filled_center_leaf(image, dpu=1000.0, width=0.1, height=0.2,  half=True):
        curve = CurveGenerator.leaf(np.linspace(0.5, 1, 50), width, height, half)
        curve = np.vstack(([0, 0], curve))
        outline_curves = [curve]
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_rect_bounded(image, curve, dpu=1000.0, x_bounds=(-0.3, 0.3), y_bounds=(-0.3, 0.3), sample_rotation=0.0):
        curve = CurveTransforms.fit_c2c(curve, x_bounds + y_bounds)
        transform = Affine2D().rotate(sample_rotation)
        curve = transform.transform(curve)
        outline_curves = [curve]
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves

class ImageSampleGenerator:
    """Predefined methods for creating ImageSample. Uses ImageSlicer and GenerateTransforms to slice an image and transform it"""
    @staticmethod
    def ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_radius, outer_radius, sample_rotation, sample_rotation + np.pi / segments)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2*segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation,
                                                          use_flip=True, flip_angle=(2*sample_rotation+np.pi/segments)/2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def serrated_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, teeth_per_segment=3, aligned=True, teeth_width=0.05, inner_radius=0.5,
                      outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.serrated_ring_arc(image, dpu, teeth_per_segment, aligned,
                                                                                     teeth_width, inner_radius, outer_radius, sample_rotation, sample_rotation + np.pi / segments)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2*segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation,
                                                          use_flip=True, flip_angle=(2*sample_rotation+np.pi/segments)/2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def sine_wave_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, periods_per_segment=3, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5,
                       outer_radius=0.8, amplitude=0.1, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu, periods_per_segment,
                                                                                      period_offset, inner_radius, outer_radius, amplitude, sample_rotation, sample_rotation + np.pi / segments)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation, use_flip=True, flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def test_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.05, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        inner_curve = (CurveGenerator.bezier(np.array([[0, 0], [0, 1], [1, 1], [1, 2]])), 1, inner_radius, width, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (CurveGenerator.bezier(np.array([[0, 0], [0, 1], [1, 1], [1, 2]])), 1, outer_radius, width, "cartesian")
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, sample_rotation,
                                                                                   sample_rotation + np.pi / segments, True)
            ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def pit_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, pits_per_segment=1, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.8, depth=0.4, gap=0.2, sample_rotation=0.0,
                   global_rotation=0.0, half=False, left_edge=False, right_edge=False) -> ImageSample:
        outer_curve = (CurveGenerator.pit(100, width, gap, pits_per_segment), 1, outer_radius, depth, "cartesian")
        inner_curve = (CurveTransforms.scale_single(CurveGenerator.pit(100, width, gap, pits_per_segment), (1, -1)), 1, inner_radius, depth, "cartesian")
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, sample_rotation,
                                                                                   sample_rotation + np.pi / segments, left_edge, right_edge)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation+global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def ring_type1(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, edge_width=0.05, sample_rotation=0.0,
                   global_rotation=0.0, half=False, left_edge=False, right_edge=False) -> ImageSample:
        inner_curve = (CurveGenerator.edge_type1(half=half), 1, inner_radius, edge_width, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (CurveGenerator.edge_type1(half=half), 1, outer_radius, edge_width, "cartesian")
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, sample_rotation,
                                                                                   sample_rotation + np.pi / segments, left_edge, right_edge)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation+global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def leaf_circle(image, dpu=1000.0, repetitions=50, radius=0.7, leaf_width=0.1, leaf_height=0.2, leaf_rotation=np.pi/6):
        circle = CurveGenerator.regular_polygon(1000, radius)
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.leaf(image, dpu, leaf_width, leaf_height, False)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        image_sample.add_additional_curve(circle)
        ImageSampleTransformer.circular_placement_additive(image_sample, radius, repetitions, None, leaf_rotation, 0, True, np.pi/2-leaf_rotation, True, False)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def leaf_center(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, radius=0.4, height=0.2, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0, left_edge=True, right_edge=False, leaf_type="sharp"):
        if leaf_type == "sharp":
            leaf = CurveGenerator.bezier(np.array([[-1, 0], [-1, 1], [0, 1], [0, 2]]))
        else:
            leaf = CurveGenerator.bezier(np.array([[-1, 0], [-1, 1], [0, 2]]))
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, None, (leaf, 1, radius, height, "cartesian"),
                                                                                    sample_rotation, sample_rotation+np.pi/segments, left_edge, right_edge)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation + global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def random_edge_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, grid_size=(5, 3), inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.1,
                         sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0, left_edge=False, right_edge=False, interpolation="spline"):
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.random_ring_arc(image, dpu, grid_size, (1, 1), inner_radius, outer_radius, width,
                                                                                   sample_rotation, sample_rotation+np.pi/segments, left_edge, right_edge, interpolation)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation+global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def regular_polygon_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, sides_per_segment=1, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0, left_edge=False, right_edge=False):
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.regular_polygon_ring_arc(image, dpu, sides_per_segment, inner_radius, outer_radius,
                                                                                            sample_rotation, sample_rotation+np.pi/segments, left_edge, right_edge)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation + global_rotation,
                                                          use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def gear_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0, left_edge=False, right_edge=False):
        return 12
    @staticmethod
    def claw_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0, left_edge=False, right_edge=False):
        return 12
    @staticmethod
    def leaf_placement(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8 , inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.2, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0):
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.leaf(image, dpu, width, outer_radius-inner_radius, True)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.mirror_persistent(image_sample, np.pi/2)
        ImageSampleTransformer.circular_placement_additive(image_sample, inner_radius, segments, None, -np.pi/2, global_rotation)
        return image_sample

class ImageSlicer:
    @staticmethod
    def sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu=1000.0):
        height = image.shape[0]
        width = image.shape[1]
        image_ar = width / height
        x1 = np.min(curve[:, 0])
        x2 = np.max(curve[:, 0])
        y1 = np.min(curve[:, 1])
        y2 = np.max(curve[:, 1])
        extent = (x1, x2, y1, y2)
        x_abs = x2 - x1
        y_abs = y2 - y1
        clip_ar = x_abs / y_abs
        if clip_ar < image_ar:
            new_height = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(height, y_abs*dpu)), height-1)
            new_width = int(new_height * clip_ar)
        else:
            new_width = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(width, x_abs*dpu)), width-1)
            new_height = int(new_width / clip_ar)
        origin = (np.random.randint(0, width - new_width), np.random.randint(0, height - new_height))
        sliced_image = image[origin[1]:origin[1] + new_height, origin[0]:origin[0] + new_width]
        path = Path(curve)
        return sliced_image, extent, path
    @staticmethod
    def ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_radius=0.0, outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, inner_radius, theta1, theta2)
        curve2 = np.flip(CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, outer_radius, theta1, theta2), 0)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def serrated_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=3, aligned=True, teeth_width=0.05, inner_radius=0.0,
                          outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6):
        segments = np.maximum(1, segments)
        theta = np.linspace(theta1, theta2, segments + 1)
        inner_rho = np.array([inner_radius + (i % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        outer_rho = np.array([outer_radius - ((i + aligned) % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        curve1 = np.vstack((inner_rho, theta)).T
        curve2 = np.vstack((outer_rho, np.flip(theta))).T
        curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, n_periods=2, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8,
                           amplitude=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/2):
        inner_curve = CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, inner_radius+amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset)
        outer_curve = np.flip(CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, outer_radius-amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset), 0)
        outline_curves = [inner_curve, outer_curve]
        curve = np.vstack((inner_curve, outer_curve))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.5, 0.05, "cartesian"),
                        outer_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.8, 0.05, "cartesian"), theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        if inner_curve is None:
            curve1 = np.array([[0, 0]])
        else:
            (curve1, periods1, radius1, width1, coordinate_type1) = inner_curve
            if coordinate_type1 == "polar":
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            else:
                curve1 = np.vstack((-curve1[:, 0], curve1[:, 1])).T
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
            curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            curve1 = np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve1, i * (theta2 - theta1) / periods1, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods1)])
        (curve2, periods2, radius2, width2, coordinate_type2) = outer_curve
        if coordinate_type2 == "polar":
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        else:
            curve2 = np.vstack((-curve2[:, 0], curve2[:, 1])).T

    def sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, n_periods=2, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8,
                           amplitude=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/2):
        inner_curve = CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, inner_radius+amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset)
        outer_curve = np.flip(CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, outer_radius-amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset), 0)
        outline_curves = [inner_curve, outer_curve]
        curve = np.vstack((inner_curve, outer_curve))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.5, 0.05, "cartesian"),
                        outer_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.8, 0.05, "cartesian"), theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        if inner_curve is None:
            curve1 = np.array([[0, 0]])
        else:
            (curve1, periods1, radius1, width1, coordinate_type1) = inner_curve
            if coordinate_type1 == "polar":
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            else:
                curve1 = np.vstack((-curve1[:, 0], curve1[:, 1])).T
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
            curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            curve1 = np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve1, i * (theta2 - theta1) / periods1, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods1)])
        (curve2, periods2, radius2, width2, coordinate_type2) = outer_curve
        if coordinate_type2 == "polar":
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        else:
            curve2 = np.vstack((-curve2[:, 0], curve2[:, 1])).T
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        curve2 = np.flip(np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve2, i*(theta2-theta1)/periods2, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods2)]), 0)
        if left_side and right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2, np.array([[curve1[0, 0], curve1[0, 1]]])))]
        elif right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2))]
        elif left_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve2, curve1))]
        else:
            outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def random_ring_arc(image, dpu=2000.0, grid_size=(5, 5), step_size=(1, 1), inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False, interpolation="spline") -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.random_edge(grid_size, step_size, interpolation)

class ImageSlicer:
    @staticmethod
    def sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu=1000.0):
        height = image.shape[0]
        width = image.shape[1]
        image_ar = width / height
        x1 = np.min(curve[:, 0])
        x2 = np.max(curve[:, 0])
        y1 = np.min(curve[:, 1])
        y2 = np.max(curve[:, 1])
        extent = (x1, x2, y1, y2)
        x_abs = x2 - x1
        y_abs = y2 - y1
        clip_ar = x_abs / y_abs
        if clip_ar < image_ar:
            new_height = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(height, y_abs*dpu)), height-1)
            new_width = int(new_height * clip_ar)
        else:
            new_width = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(width, x_abs*dpu)), width-1)
            new_height = int(new_width / clip_ar)
        origin = (np.random.randint(0, width - new_width), np.random.randint(0, height - new_height))
        sliced_image = image[origin[1]:origin[1] + new_height, origin[0]:origin[0] + new_width]
        path = Path(curve)
        return sliced_image, extent, path
    @staticmethod
    def ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_radius=0.0, outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, inner_radius, theta1, theta2)
        curve2 = np.flip(CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, outer_radius, theta1, theta2), 0)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def serrated_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=3, aligned=True, teeth_width=0.05, inner_radius=0.0,
                          outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6):
        segments = np.maximum(1, segments)
        theta = np.linspace(theta1, theta2, segments + 1)
        inner_rho = np.array([inner_radius + (i % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        outer_rho = np.array([outer_radius - ((i + aligned) % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        curve1 = np.vstack((inner_rho, theta)).T
        curve2 = np.vstack((outer_rho, np.flip(theta))).T
        curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, n_periods=2, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8,
                           amplitude=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/2):
        inner_curve = CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, inner_radius+amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset)
        outer_curve = np.flip(CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, outer_radius-amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset), 0)
        outline_curves = [inner_curve, outer_curve]
        curve = np.vstack((inner_curve, outer_curve))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.5, 0.05, "cartesian"),
                        outer_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.8, 0.05, "cartesian"), theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        if inner_curve is None:
            curve1 = np.array([[0, 0]])
        else:
            (curve1, periods1, radius1, width1, coordinate_type1) = inner_curve
            if coordinate_type1 == "polar":
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            else:
                curve1 = np.vstack((-curve1[:, 0], curve1[:, 1])).T
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
            curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            curve1 = np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve1, i * (theta2 - theta1) / periods1, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods1)])
        (curve2, periods2, radius2, width2, coordinate_type2) = outer_curve
        if coordinate_type2 == "polar":
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        else:
            curve2 = np.vstack((-curve2[:, 0], curve2[:, 1])).T
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        curve2 = np.flip(np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve2, i*(theta2-theta1)/periods2, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods2)]), 0)
        if left_side and right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2, np.array([[curve1[0, 0], curve1[0, 1]]])))]
        elif right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2))]
        elif left_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve2, curve1))]
        else:
            outline_curves = [curve1]
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def random_ring_arc(image, dpu=2000.0, grid_size=(5, 5), step_size=(1, 1), inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,

class ImageSampleGenerator:
    """Predefined methods for creating ImageSample. Uses ImageSlicer and GenerateTransforms to slice an image and transform it"""
    @staticmethod
    def ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_radius, outer_radius, sample_rotation, sample_rotation + np.pi / segments)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2*segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation,
                                                          use_flip=True, flip_angle=(2*sample_rotation+np.pi/segments)/2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def serrated_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, teeth_per_segment=3, aligned=True, teeth_width=0.05, inner_radius=0.5,
                      outer_radius=0.8, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.serrated_ring_arc(image, dpu, teeth_per_segment, aligned,
                                                                                     teeth_width, inner_radius, outer_radius, sample_rotation, sample_rotation + np.pi / segments)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2*segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation,
                                                          use_flip=True, flip_angle=(2*sample_rotation+np.pi/segments)/2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def sine_wave_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, periods_per_segment=3, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5,
                       outer_radius=0.8, amplitude=0.1, sample_rotation=0.0) -> ImageSample:
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu, periods_per_segment,
                                                                                      period_offset, inner_radius, outer_radius, amplitude, sample_rotation, sample_rotation + np.pi / segments)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None, rotation_offset=-sample_rotation, use_flip=True, flip_angle=0.0)
        outer_curve = (CurveGenerator.bezier(np.array([[0, 0], [0, 1], [1, 1], [1, 2]])), 1, outer_radius, width, "cartesian")
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, sample_rotation,
                                                                                   sample_rotation + np.pi / segments, True)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def pit_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, pits_per_segment=1, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.8, depth=0.4, gap=0.2, sample_rotation=0.0,
                   global_rotation=0.0, half=False, left_edge=False, right_edge=False) -> ImageSample:
        outer_curve = (CurveGenerator.pit(100, width, gap, pits_per_segment), 1, outer_radius, depth, "cartesian")
        inner_curve = (CurveTransforms.scale_single(CurveGenerator.pit(100, width, gap, pits_per_segment), (1, -1)), 1, inner_radius, depth, "cartesian")
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, sample_rotation,
                                                                                   sample_rotation + np.pi / segments, left_edge, right_edge)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation+global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def ring_type1(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, edge_width=0.05, sample_rotation=0.0,
                   global_rotation=0.0, half=False, left_edge=False, right_edge=False) -> ImageSample:
        inner_curve = (CurveGenerator.edge_type1(half=half), 1, inner_radius, edge_width, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (CurveGenerator.edge_type1(half=half), 1, outer_radius, edge_width, "cartesian")
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, sample_rotation,
                                                                                   sample_rotation + np.pi / segments, left_edge, right_edge)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.rotational_repeat_additive(image_sample, 2 * segments, None,
                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation+global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def leaf_circle(image, dpu=1000.0, repetitions=50, radius=0.7, leaf_width=0.1, leaf_height=0.2, leaf_rotation=np.pi/6):
        circle = CurveGenerator.regular_polygon(1000, radius)
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.leaf(image, dpu, leaf_width, leaf_height, False)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        image_sample.add_additional_curve(circle)
        ImageSampleTransformer.circular_placement_additive(image_sample, radius, repetitions, None, leaf_rotation, 0, True, np.pi/2-leaf_rotation, True, False)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def leaf_center(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, radius=0.4, height=0.2, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0, left_edge=True, right_edge=False, leaf_type="sharp"):
        if leaf_type == "sharp":

        else:
            leaf = CurveGenerator.bezier(np.array([[-1, 0], [-1, 1], [0, 2]]))
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, None, (leaf, 1, radius, height, "cartesian"),

                                                          rotation_offset=-sample_rotation + global_rotation, use_flip=True,
                                                          flip_angle=(2 * sample_rotation + np.pi / segments) / 2)
        return image_sample
    @staticmethod
    def random_edge_ring(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8, grid_size=(5, 3), inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.1,

        return 12
    @staticmethod
    def leaf_placement(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=8 , inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.2, sample_rotation=0.0, global_rotation=0.0):
        (image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.leaf(image, dpu, width, outer_radius-inner_radius, True)
        image_sample = ImageSample(image_sliced, extent, path, outline_curves)
        ImageSampleTransformer.mirror_persistent(image_sample, np.pi/2)
        ImageSampleTransformer.circular_placement_additive(image_sample, inner_radius, segments, None, -np.pi/2, global_rotation)
        return image_sample

class ImageSlicer:
    @staticmethod
    def sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu=1000.0):
        height = image.shape[0]
        width = image.shape[1]
        image_ar = width / height
        x1 = np.min(curve[:, 0])
        x2 = np.max(curve[:, 0])
        y1 = np.min(curve[:, 1])
        y2 = np.max(curve[:, 1])
        extent = (x1, x2, y1, y2)
        x_abs = x2 - x1
        y_abs = y2 - y1
        clip_ar = x_abs / y_abs
        if clip_ar < image_ar:
            new_height = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(height, y_abs*dpu)), height-1)
            new_width = int(new_height * clip_ar)
        else:
            new_width = np.minimum(int(np.minimum(width, y_abs*dpu)), width-1)
        sliced_image = image[origin[1]:origin[1] + new_height, origin[0]:origin[0] + new_width]
        path = Path(curve)
        return sliced_image, extent, path
    @staticmethod
    def ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_radius=0.0, outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, inner_radius, theta1, theta2)
        curve2 = np.flip(CurveGenerator.circular_arc(100, outer_radius, theta1, theta2), 0)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def serrated_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, segments=3, aligned=True, teeth_width=0.05, inner_radius=0.0,
                          outer_radius=1.0, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi / 6):
        segments = np.maximum(1, segments)
        theta = np.linspace(theta1, theta2, segments + 1)
        inner_rho = np.array([inner_radius + (i % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        outer_rho = np.array([outer_radius - ((i + aligned) % 2) * teeth_width for i in range(segments + 1)])
        curve1 = np.vstack((inner_rho, theta)).T
        curve2 = np.vstack((outer_rho, np.flip(theta))).T
        curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def sine_wave_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, n_periods=2, period_offset=0.25, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8,
                           amplitude=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/2):
        inner_curve = CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, inner_radius+amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset)
        outer_curve = np.flip(CurveGenerator.sine_wave_circular_arc(100, outer_radius-amplitude, theta1, theta2, amplitude, n_periods, period_offset), 0)
        outline_curves = [inner_curve, outer_curve]
        curve = np.vstack((inner_curve, outer_curve))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_ring_arc(image, dpu=1000.0, inner_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.5, 0.05, "cartesian"),
                        outer_curve: (np.ndarray, int, float, str) = (np.array([[0.0, 0.0]]), 1, 0.8, 0.05, "cartesian"), theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False) -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        if inner_curve is None:
            curve1 = np.array([[0, 0]])
        else:
            (curve1, periods1, radius1, width1, coordinate_type1) = inner_curve
            if coordinate_type1 == "polar":
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            else:
                curve1 = np.vstack((-curve1[:, 0], curve1[:, 1])).T
                curve1 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve1, (radius1, radius1+width1), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods1))
            curve1 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve1)
            curve1 = np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve1, i * (theta2 - theta1) / periods1, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods1)])
        (curve2, periods2, radius2, width2, coordinate_type2) = outer_curve
        if coordinate_type2 == "polar":
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_remap_polar_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        else:
            curve2 = np.vstack((-curve2[:, 0], curve2[:, 1])).T
            curve2 = CurveTransforms.tight_map_cartesian_to_polar(curve2, (radius2 - width2, radius2), (theta1, theta1 + (theta2-theta1)/periods2))
        curve2 = CurveTransforms.polar_to_cartesian(curve2)
        curve2 = np.flip(np.vstack([CurveTransforms.rotate_single(curve2, i*(theta2-theta1)/periods2, inplace=False) for i in range(0, periods2)]), 0)
        if left_side and right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2, np.array([[curve1[0, 0], curve1[0, 1]]])))]
        elif right_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve1, curve2))]
        elif left_side:
            outline_curves = [np.vstack((curve2, curve1))]
        else:
            outline_curves = [curve1, curve2]
        curve = np.vstack((curve1, curve2))
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def random_ring_arc(image, dpu=2000.0, grid_size=(5, 5), step_size=(1, 1), inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, width=0.1, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6,
                        left_side=False, right_side=False, interpolation="spline") -> (np.ndarray, (float, float, float, float), Path, List[np.ndarray]):
        curve1 = CurveGenerator.random_edge(grid_size, step_size, interpolation)
        curve2 = CurveGenerator.random_edge(grid_size, step_size, interpolation)
        inner_curve = (curve1, 1, inner_radius, width, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (curve2, 1, outer_radius, width, "cartesian")
        (image, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve, theta1, theta2, left_side, right_side)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def regular_polygon_ring_arc(image, dpu=2000.0, sides=1, inner_radius=0.5, outer_radius=0.8, theta1=0.0, theta2=np.pi/6, left_side=False, right_side=False):
        curve = np.array((np.linspace(0, 1, sides+1), np.zeros(sides+1))).T
        inner_curve = (curve, 1, inner_radius, 0, "cartesian")
        outer_curve = (curve, 1, outer_radius, 0, "cartesian")
        (image, extent, path, outline_curves) = ImageSlicer.custom_ring_arc(image, dpu, inner_curve, outer_curve,
                                                                            theta1, theta2, left_side, right_side)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def leaf(image, dpu=1000.0, width=0.1, height=0.2, half=False):
        curve = CurveGenerator.leaf(np.linspace(0, 1, 100), width, height, half)
        outline_curves = [curve]
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def filled_center_leaf(image, dpu=1000.0, width=0.1, height=0.2,  half=True):
        curve = CurveGenerator.leaf(np.linspace(0.5, 1, 50), width, height, half)
        curve = np.vstack(([0, 0], curve))
        outline_curves = [curve]
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
    @staticmethod
    def custom_rect_bounded(image, curve, dpu=1000.0, x_bounds=(-0.3, 0.3), y_bounds=(-0.3, 0.3), sample_rotation=0.0):
        curve = CurveTransforms.fit_c2c(curve, x_bounds + y_bounds)
        transform = Affine2D().rotate(sample_rotation)
        curve = transform.transform(curve)
        outline_curves = [curve]
        (image, extent, path) = ImageSlicer.sample_from_curve(image, curve, dpu)
        return image, extent, path, outline_curves
